verses.text: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the accursed thing : for Achan , the son of Carmi , the son of Zabdi , the son of Zerah , of the tribe of Judah , took of the accursed thing : and the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was kindled against the children of Israel.\f + \fr 7.1 \ft Achan: also called, Achar\f*\f + \fr 7.1 \ft Zabdi: also called, Zimri\f*

And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai , which \add is\add* beside Beth-aven , on the east side of Beth-el , and spake unto them, saying , Go up and view the country. And the men went up and viewed Ai.

And they returned to Joshua , and said unto him, Let not all the people go up ; but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite Ai ; \add and\add* make not all the people to labour thither; for they \add are but\add* few.\f + \fr 7.3 \ft about…: Heb. about two thousand men, or, about three thousand men\f*
So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men : and they fled before the men of Ai.

And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty and six men : for they chased them \add from\add* before the gate \add even\add* unto Shebarim , and smote them in the going down : wherefore the hearts of the people melted , and became as water.\f + \fr 7.5 \ft in…: or, in Morad\f* \p

¶ And Joshua rent his clothes , and fell to the earth upon his face before the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* until the eventide , he and the elders of Israel , and put dust upon their heads.

And Joshua said , Alas, O Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, wherefore hast thou at all brought this people over Jordan , to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites , to destroy us? would to God we had been content , and dwelt on the other side Jordan !
O Lord , what shall I say , when Israel turneth their backs before their enemies !\f + \fr 7.8 \ft backs: Heb. necks\f*
For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land shall hear \add of it\add*, and shall environ us round , and cut off our name from the earth : and what wilt thou do unto thy great name ? \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Joshua , Get thee up ; wherefore liest thou thus upon thy face ?\f + \fr 7.10 \ft liest: Heb. fallest\f*

Israel hath sinned , and they have also transgressed my covenant which I commanded them: for they have even taken of the accursed thing , and have also stolen , and dissembled also, and they have put \add it\add* even among their own stuff.

Therefore the children of Israel could not stand before their enemies , \add but\add* turned \add their\add* backs before their enemies , because they were accursed : neither will I be with you any more , except ye destroy the accursed from among you.

Up , sanctify the people , and say , Sanctify yourselves against to morrow : for thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , \add There is\add* an accursed thing in the midst of thee, O Israel : thou canst not stand before thine enemies , until ye take away the accursed thing from among you.

In the morning therefore ye shall be brought according to your tribes : and it shall be, \add that\add* the tribe which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* taketh shall come according to the families \add thereof;\add* and the family which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall take shall come by households ; and the household which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall take shall come man by man.

And it shall be, \add that\add* he that is taken with the accursed thing shall be burnt with fire , he and all that he hath: because he hath transgressed the covenant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and because he hath wrought folly in Israel.\f + \fr 7.15 \ft folly: or, wickedness\f* \p
¶ So Joshua rose up early in the morning , and brought Israel by their tribes ; and the tribe of Judah was taken :
And he brought the family of Judah ; and he took the family of the Zarhites : and he brought the family of the Zarhites man by man ; and Zabdi was taken :
And he brought his household man by man ; and Achan , the son of Carmi , the son of Zabdi , the son of Zerah , of the tribe of Judah , was taken.

And Joshua said unto Achan , My son , give , I pray thee, glory to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , and make confession unto him; and tell me now what thou hast done ; hide \add it\add* not from me.
And Achan answered Joshua , and said , Indeed I have sinned against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , and thus and thus have I done :

When I saw among the spoils a goodly Babylonish garment , and two hundred shekels of silver , and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight , then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they \add are\add* hid in the earth in the midst of my tent , and the silver under it.\f + \fr 7.21 \ft wedge: Heb. tongue\f* \p
¶ So Joshua sent messengers , and they ran unto the tent ; and, behold, \add it was\add* hid in his tent , and the silver under it.

And they took them out of the midst of the tent , and brought them unto Joshua , and unto all the children of Israel , and laid them out before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 7.23 \ft laid: Heb. poured\f*

And Joshua , and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah , and the silver , and the garment , and the wedge of gold , and his sons , and his daughters , and his oxen , and his asses , and his sheep , and his tent , and all that he had: and they brought them unto the valley of Achor.

And Joshua said , Why hast thou troubled us? the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones , and burned them with fire , after they had stoned them with stones.

And they raised over him a great heap of stones unto this day. So the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* turned from the fierceness of his anger. Wherefore the name of that place was called , The valley of Achor , unto this day.\f + \fr 7.26 \ft Achor: that is, Trouble\f*
